Summary: Object #1 near ISS headed due east. Ojbect #2 2 min later headed South
trends: There have been 15 other sightings in Belleville
There were no other sightings in Belleville on or around June 25th 2009
divs: sighting detailsarrived home from camping at 9:30pm just in time to see the shuttle\iss (docked together) at 9:34 i believe. watched it go by from w to sse (i believe). near the end of its visible path i started unloading camp gear from my pickup truck. my 8 year old son said "hey dad there is something flying by (or following...dont recall exactly) the space station". i doubted his observation but looked about 15 seconds later and yep he was right. it wasn't following it when i seen it but it was headed almost due east (about two inches away at arms length when i fist saw it). perhaps they nearly intersected when he seen it so it looked to be right by it. i know airplanes well and consider myself an excellent spotter and i was saying at the time that it sure doesn't look like an aircraft. if it was it had to be at nearly 20-30k feet up and several miles south of us with its light on. actaully it was lit up like a dim star then after a second or two would fade out slowly over a one or two second timespan then go all the way out, then fade back in. it consistently did this. it did not appear to be a typical nav light or comparable. i considered it maybe a satellite rotating on its own axis and reflecting the sun at each revolution maybe? after a minute of so it went behind some trees. a minute or two later at maybe 9:37ish i happened to look up as i climbed my pickup bed to get more gear. somehow i noticed another moving star type object. i couldn't believe it. i called my son over and he too saw it. it was just like a dim star moving n to s. same iss speed and constant light not fading in\out like ojbect #1. watched it for about 2 minutes and it too went behind some trees. again i doubted it was an aircraft and thought it really looked like a satellite. my son and i have seen the iss and\or shuttle a good 20 times or more and watch it every chance we get. we have it down to the science half the time and can step out the door and see it immediately. we never seen another satellite that we know of so its odd to see maybe 2 the same time an iss sighting is going on. oh yes...one last thing which is very interesting. i overheard a guy at work saying his wife and kids saw a light trailing nearby the iss and then it moved off away from the iss. this tells me it was not an aircraft. they live about 60 miles nnw from me which would make an aircraft (if thats what it was) look way off to their se i would imagine while the iss would still appear in the same location. so object #1 was not an aircraft. ojbect #2 was not noticed by them. perhaps this was (one or both) a satellite but i cannot find anything on the internet to go back a few days and see the path\times. please please please let me know if there are others that saw this! thank you
